labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to capture and manage the reasoning and thought processes of an LLM or user. It provides tools to record, retrieve, analyze, and clear thoughts during a session, making it useful for structured decision-making, complex problem-solving, and maintaining a organized thought history. The primary focus is on cognitive process management and augmentation.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Memory Management" was chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around storing, retrieving, and analyzing thoughts (a form of cognitive data). Secondary labels "Daily Productivity" and "AI/ML Tools" were selected because the server aids in productivity through better thought organization and enhances AI capabilities by capturing reasoning processes. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately describe the server's functionality.

tools.name: clear_thoughts
tools.description: Clear all recorded thoughts from the current session. Use this to start fresh if the thinking process needs to be reset.

tools.name: get_thought_stats
tools.description: Get statistics about the thoughts recorded in the current session.

tools.name: get_thoughts
tools.description: Retrieve all thoughts recorded in the current session. This tool helps review the thinking process that has occurred so far.

tools.name: think
tools.description: Use this tool to think about something. It will not obtain new information or change anything, but just append the thought to the log. Use it when complex reasoning or cache memory is needed.

thought.description: A thought to think about. This can be structured reasoning, step-by-step analysis, policy verification, or any other mental process that helps with problem-solving.

server_info_crawled.name: Think Tool
server_info_crawled.author: @iamwavecut/mcp-think
server_info_crawled.overview: Record and retrieve your reasoning processes seamlessly. Enhance your LLM's capabilities by capturing thoughts and analyzing them for better decision-making. Clear your thought history effortlessly to maintain focus on current tasks.

tools.name: clear_thoughts
tools.description: Clear all recorded thoughts from the current session. Use this to start fresh if the thinking process needs to be reset.

tools.name: get_thought_stats
tools.description: Get statistics about the thoughts recorded in the current session.

tools.name: get_thoughts
tools.description: Retrieve all thoughts recorded in the current session. This tool helps review the thinking process that has occurred so far.

tools.name: think
tools.description: Use this tool to think about something. It will not obtain new information or change anything, but just append the thought to the log. Use it when complex reasoning or cache memory is needed.

thought.description: A thought to think about. This can be structured reasoning, step-by-step analysis, policy verification, or any other mental process that helps with problem-solving.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@iamwavecut/mcp-think/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
